comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think this is on Bennelong Point looking east, and that is Fort Macquarie at right. Ship and Garden Island behind. Reverse view showing stonework and building with clerestory (right hand side of image) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=824048&am...

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
There are two groups of men in this photograph.  The group at right are sailors and can be distinguished by their sailors' caps.
The group at left seem to be bandsmen.  They are wearing a different type of cap. One man is holding a euphonium and another is holding a cornet.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It looks like they arrived c.100 years too early for their concert at the Opera House!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Well spotted! Those musical instruments are almost camouflaged amongst the uniforms. 

Will let you know when we have replaced this image with a larger version...for those of us with poorer eyesight!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Larger version available. Now I can see those instruments.
